author: Jessica Valenti

title: All things are subject to interpretation whichever interpretation prevails at a given time is a function of power and not truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

author: Feisal Abdul Rauf

author: Alan Watts

author: Tom Hanks

author: Mary Harris Jones

author: Aaron Brown

author: Francis Bacon

author: Amy Tan

title: The truth always finds it's way out, even years and years and years later. The truth always prevails.
author: Tyler Hamilton

author: Kelly Miller

author: John McCain

author: Max Born

author: Sia

author: Mary Baker Eddy

author: Claudette Colvin

title: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.
author: Muhammad Ali

author: Orlando Bloom

title: Acting is about finding truth and finding the way to convey the truth.
author: Daveed Diggs

title: It does not require many words to speak the truth.
author: Chief Joseph

title: Truth is the cry of all, but the game of few.
author: George Berkeley

author: Aldous Huxley

author: Shakira

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

author: Sylvester Stallone

author: Jane Fonda

author: David Mamet

author: Gore Vidal

author: Sophocles

author: Lucy Stone

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

author: William Randolph

author: H. P. Lovecraft

author: Harry S Truman

author: Avigdor Lieberman

author: Dave Sim

title: We have art in order not to die of the truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

author: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez

title: Power is domination, control, and therefore a very selective form of truth which is a lie.
author: Wole Soyinka

author: Hannah Arendt

author: Cindy Sheehan

author: Molly Ivins

author: Ellen DeGeneres

author: David Hume

author: Denis Villeneuve

author: Richard Dawkins

author: Peter Guber

author: Liu Xiaobo

author: James Madison

title: The world is too dangerous for anything but truth and too small for anything but love.
author: William Sloane Coffin

author: Benjamin E. Mays

author: Thiruvalluvar

author: Adam Curtis

author: Claude Adrien Helvetius

author: Mahatma Gandhi

author: Tony Evans

author: Peter Lindbergh

author: Pierre Bayle

author: Katherine Mansfield

author: Robert Green Ingersoll

author: Carl Bernstein

author: Max Planck

author: George Harrison

author: Albert Einstein

author: Gottfried Leibniz

title: The truth is not for all men, but only for those who seek it.

author: Thomas Becket

author: Mary Todd Lincoln

author: Hrithik Roshan

author: Aldous Huxley

author: Mohsen Makhmalbaf

title: There's no point in saying anything but the truth.
author: Amy Winehouse

title: Books and all forms of writing are terror to those who wish to suppress the truth.
author: Wole Soyinka

author: Blaise Pascal

author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

author: Lucretia Mott

author: Umberto Eco

author: Adlai Stevenson I

author: Maya Angelou

author: Bill Hicks

author: Michael Kinsley

author: Jeanette Winterson

author: Frederick Law Olmsted

author: Don Miguel Ruiz

author: Drake

author: N. T. Wright

title: The truth is on the march and nothing will stop it.
author: Emile Zola

author: Andre Gide

author: Isaac Newton

author: Isaac Newton

author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

author: Samuel Goldwyn

author: H. Rap Brown

author: Arthur Conan Doyle

author: Gao Xingjian

author: L. Lionel Kendrick

author: Ravi Zacharias

author: Adlai Stevenson II

title: Love is the crowning grace of humanity, the holiest right of the soul, the golden link which binds us to duty and truth, the redeeming principle that chiefly reconciles the heart to life, and is prophetic of eternal good.
author: Petrarch

author: Chrisette Michele

author: Alice Walker

title: Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable than fidelity. Faithfulness and truth are the most sacred excellences and endowments of the human mind.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

author: Arnold Bennett

title: Truth is a hard deer to hunt. If you eat too much truth at once, you may die of the truth.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

author: Walter Lippmann

author: James Allen

title: It is a simple but sometimes forgotten truth that the greatest enemy to present joy and high hopes is the cultivation of retrospective bitterness.
author: Robert Menzies

author: Stella Adler

title: The goal of education is the advancement of knowledge and the dissemination of truth.
author: John F. Kennedy

title: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

title: We don't regard any scientific theory as the absolute truth.
author: Kenneth R. Miller

author: Giordano Bruno

author: Henry David Thoreau

author: Samoa Joe

author: Wendell Berry

title: Give me the fruitful error any time, full of seeds, bursting with its own corrections. You can keep your sterile truth for yourself.
author: Vilfredo Pareto

title: I chose to pursue a career in physics because there the truth isn't so easily bent.
author: Angela Merkel

title: You never monkey with the truth.

title: Truth is, in fact, an elusive concept. It depends almost entirely on where you are standing at the time. It is a human instinct to confuse belief with truth.

author: Henry A. Wallace

title: If you walk on the path of truth all the powers in the universe help you.
author: Arvind Kejriwal

title: Science is the search for truth, that is the effort to understand the world: it involves the rejection of bias, of dogma, of revelation, but not the rejection of morality.
author: Linus Pauling

author: Alan Rudolph

title: Accusations fit on a bumper sticker; the truth takes longer.

author: Luke Rhinehart

title: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the heart's affections, and the truth of imagination.
author: John Keats

title: He who does not bellow the truth when he knows the truth makes himself the accomplice of liars and forgers.

author: Guru Nanak

title: I do not fear truth. I welcome it. But I wish all of my facts to be in their proper context.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

title: Seeing the bigger picture opens your eyes to what is the truth.
author: Wadada Leo Smith

title: It is a melancholy truth that even great men have their poor relations.
author: Charles Dickens

title: It is an old maxim of mine that when you have excluded the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

title: Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt is, there truth is - it is her shadow.
author: Ambrose Bierce

title: Truth is the best defense.
author: Ward Churchill

title: My religion is based on truth and non-violence. Truth is my God. Non-violence is the means of realising Him.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

title: You must accept the truth from whatever source it comes.
author: Maimonides

title: Mythology is a subjective truth. Every culture imagines life a certain way.
author: Devdutt Pattanaik

title: The truth is lived, not taught.
author: Hermann Hesse

title: I would love to have an ocean of love right now. That said, the number-one rule of acting is, 'Do not seek approval from the audience.' People don't realize that. You can't do stuff to get applause. You have to live in the truth.

author: Albert Einstein

title: It's so essential to happiness to speak your truth out loud - because this sharing of your core pain is what creates a necessary healing shift - from negative beliefs about the world - to positive beliefs - and frees you up to be able to fully view life with meaning, purpose and connection with others.
author: Karen Salmansohn

title: Once, Pee-wee Herman tweeted a photo of this guitar I made that's shaped like a slice of pizza, and it meant a lot to me. author: Andrew W.K.

title: The worst enemy of truth and freedom in our society is the compact majority.
author: Henrik Ibsen

title: If history and science have taught us anything, it is that passion and desire are not the same as truth.
author: E. O. Wilson

title: Poetry is truth in its Sunday clothes.
author: Joseph Roux

title: Not everyone can see the truth, but he can be it.
author: Franz Kafka

title: My most heartfelt thank you goes to Impact Future Media and Cartoon Monkey Studio. Their dedication to the truth is very uncommon in the world we live in today. I am now, and will always be, grateful to their organizations.
author: John McAfee

title: Since the day the Obama administration first launched its duplicitous Benghazi cover story, Judicial Watch has been pressing for the full truth.
author: Tom Fitton

title: Before anything else, we need a new age of Enlightenment. Our present political systems must relinquish their claims on truth, justice and freedom and have to replace them with the search for truth, justice, freedom and reason.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

title: You can't get there alone. People have to help you, and I do believe in karma. I believe in paybacks. You get people to help you by telling the truth, by being earnest.
author: Randy Pausch

title: The only way into truth is through one's own annihilation; through dwelling a long time in a state of extreme and total humiliation.
author: Simone Weil

title: To kill an error is as good a service as, and sometimes even better than, the establishing of a new truth or fact.
author: Charles Darwin

title: The truth is in nature, and I shall prove it.
author: Paul Cezanne

title: No human being will ever know the Truth, for even if they happen to say it by chance, they would not even known they had done so.
author: Xenophanes

title: A word of truth can mobilise two peoples looking for the road to reconciliation.
author: Donald Tusk

title: Man can embody truth but he cannot know it.
author: William Butler Yeats

title: Truth is eternal, unchanging, though circumstances may and do operate to give a different colour to it, in our view, at different times. And truth will prevail, and those who do not yield to it must be destroyed by it.
author: Elijah Parish Lovejoy

title: To the scientist there is the joy in pursuing truth which nearly counteracts the depressing revelations of truth.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

title: When I was a young person I went to the university and I learned a rational language, to think with the left side of the brain. Symbols have a language that kills the words.
author: Alejandro Jodorowsky

title: I've been the luckiest man in the world because I've had friends, and to have the right friends is everything: people you can depend on, people who tell you the truth if you ask something.
author: Stan Lee

title: Too much and too little wine. Give him none, he cannot find truth; give him too much, the same.
author: Blaise Pascal

title: We're so immaturely cynical as a culture. We're not wise enough to look at an institution like marriage and to really things about what it means and what it signifies. author: Jordan Peterson

title: There are two ways to worry words. One is hoping for the greatest possible beauty in what is created. The other is to tell the truth.
author: June Jordan

title: The ultimate aim of the human mind, in all its efforts, is to become acquainted with Truth.
author: Eliza Farnham

title: We tend to think of racism as this interpersonal verbal or physical abuse, when in truth, that is only one way that racism manifests itself. author: Clint Smith

title: What is laid down, ordered, factual is never enough to embrace the whole truth: life always spills over the rim of every cup.
author: Boris Pasternak

title: It seems a fantastic paradox, but it is nevertheless a most important truth, that no architecture can be truly noble which is not imperfect.
author: John Ruskin
